meanings.definition: A name derived from the name of a father or ancestor.
meanings.sent1: My friend's last name is a patronymic, meaning it comes from his father's name.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, a patronymic is used to honor the family lineage.
meanings.sent3: When I learned that my classmate's surname was a patronymic, I joked that he must be his father's favorite!
meanings.sent4: The patronymic carried by each generation serves as a link to the past.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a patronymic helps trace a person's ancestry through their name.

meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from the name of a father or ancestor.
meanings.sent1: The family tree project required us to include patronymic details to show the lineage.
meanings.sent2: She proudly displayed her patronymic necklace, symbolizing her heritage.
meanings.sent3: The patronymic connection between siblings was evident in their similar last names.
meanings.sent4: His patronymic heritage shone through in his traditional values and customs.
meanings.sent5: The patronymic influence was clear in the naming traditions of the community.
